content: mass or new bump at the ulnar border of the index finger DIP joint
title: Chief Complaint

content: The patient reports noticing a mass or new bump on the ulnar border of her index finger DIP joint a few weeks ago. She states the lesion does not limit movement but is concerned because it differs from the typical arthritic bumps she usually experiences. She reports no pain associated with the mass. She also notes overall improvement in wrist function, being able to lift weights and perform activities with less pain, although she continues to have occasional aches in the wrist and shoulder.

title: Assessment

content: continue home exercise program , continue advancing activity , return to clinic in 6 months for follow up .
